ArticleTitle.sentence: Cupric ion blocks NF kappa B activation through inhibiting the signal-induced phosphorylation of I kappa B alpha.

AbstractText.sentence: A transcription factor NF kappa B, which regulates expression of various cellular genes involved in immune responses and viral genes including HIV, is sequestered in the cytoplasm as a complex with an inhibitory protein I kappa B.

AbstractText.sentence: Various extracellular signals induce phosphorylation and rapid degradation of I kappa B alpha to release NF kappa B.

AbstractText.sentence: Cu2+ was found to inhibit the activation of NF kappa B induced by TNF-alpha, TPA, or H2O2.

AbstractText.sentence: Deoxycholate treatment of the cytoplasmic extract prepared from cells stimulated by TNF-alpha in the presence of Cu2+ resulted in the release of NF kappa B from I kappa B alpha, indicating that Cu2+ interferes with the dissociation of the NF kappa B-I kappa B complex.

event.clue: Deoxycholate treatment of the cytoplasmic extract prepared from cells stimulated by TNF-alpha in the presence of Cu2+ resulted in the release of NF kappa B from I kappa B alpha, indicating that Cu2+ interferes with the dissociation of the NF kappa B-I kappa B complex.
